page.title: 05FARMING _DAIRYING
page.content: My{milk}was once grass until the{cows chewed it up.They eat lots of grass then sit down and chew it.{Cows}won't give any{milk}unless they have had a calf.The{cows}go into the milking parlour twice a day,at 6.30 a.m. and 4.30.p.m.Every{cow}wears a band with a transponder on.When she pushes her head into the stall the transponder tells the computer how much food to give to the {cow.}The farmer washes the{cow's}udder so that germs don't get in the{milk.}Then the farmer puts the machine clusters on the teats.The milk is sucked out into the pipe, then transferred into a bulk tank.There is a paddle inside.It turns round.The tank keeps the{milk}cool.Every day a tanker collects the{milk}and takes it to the{dairy.
